name: White Miso Ramen
description: This is the very first miso ramen ever created at Mitsukabose—a bowl that captures our origins. The soup is made with a smooth white miso base, gently enriched with the comforting aroma of Japanese dashi. Its mild, savory flavor brings warmth to the soul with every sip. Toppings include tender slices of chashu pork, aromatic green onions, house-made chicken meatballs (tsukune), and sweet onions that enhance the broth's natural richness. Each element pairs harmoniously with the soup, offering a satisfying and balanced experience in every bite. Finished with thin noodles that gently soak up the white miso flavor, this bowl is loved by everyone—from seasoned ramen fans to children tasting miso ramen for the first time.

name: Red Miso Ramen
description: A masterful blend of several red misos creates a broth rich in umami and complexity. Bold yet balanced, the soup offers a satisfying depth of flavor. Toppings include tender, melt-in-your-mouth chashu pork, springy handmade chicken meatballs, and refreshing green onions that add brightness to each bite. Medium-thick noodles soak up the flavorful broth perfectly, creating a delicious harmony of taste and texture in every mouthful. A classic bowl with timeless richness and heartwarming comfort.

name: Spicy Miso Ramen
description: This rich and complex ramen brings together the bold kick of Japanese miso with the deep, sweet heat of Korean-style spicy miso. The star topping—torched cheese—melts into the broth, creating a creamy, smoky richness that takes the flavor to the next level. Toppings like tender chashu pork, green onions, handmade chicken meatballs, and strips of roasted seaweed (bara nori) add unique textures and aromas, making every bite exciting and satisfying. A luxurious bowl for spice lovers—especially those who can't resist melty, golden cheese.

name: Miso Tsukemen
description: A long-standing customer favorite, this richly flavored miso tsukemen features a balanced blend of white miso and spicy miso in a deeply satisfying dipping broth. Stir-fried vegetables add a smoky aroma that pairs beautifully with the soup, while our house-made garlic oil (mayu) brings extra depth and umami to every bite. A flavorful, hearty bowl made for miso lovers.

name: Vegan Tantanmen
description: Don't let the word 'vegan' fool you—this is a truly rich and satisfying bowl of tantanmen, full of depth and umami. The broth is crafted without any animal products or fish. Instead, we combine a savory base of shiitake mushrooms and kombu seaweed with creamy soy milk and sake kasu (sake lees) from the renowned Akishika Sake Brewery. The result is a smooth, mellow soup that warms you from the inside out. We use Kāchan Miso, a lovingly made local miso from Toyono Town, to give the bowl a home-style richness. On top, our special vegan 'meat miso' is made from pea-based plant protein and enhanced with a secret ingredient that brings everything together beautifully. Enjoy the deep, nutty aroma and complex flavor of this plant-powered tantanmen—it might just change your mind about vegan ramen.

name: Vegetable Miso Ramen
description: A luxurious white miso potage made by slow-simmering potatoes, corn, edamame, and more—this rich, velvety broth captures the natural sweetness of vegetables and the umami of miso. Each bowl is topped with a generous selection of fresh, seasonal vegetables, offering a vibrant taste of nature's bounty. Paired with medium-thin whole wheat noodles, this ramen is not only flavorful but also full of texture and nourishment. Gluten-free noodles are also available upon request, making this bowl a delicious and inclusive choice for all.

name: Hokkaido-Style Miso Corn Ramen
description: This deeply flavorful bowl features a bold blend of white miso and spicy miso in a hearty soup that's both mellow and packed with umami. Sweet corn and fermented butter melt into the broth, while a drizzle of hot aromatic oil adds a roasted depth that brings everything together beautifully. Topped with tender chashu pork, fragrant green onions, and a mountain of crisp white shredded leeks (shiraganegi), the soup's richness is perfectly matched with thick, chewy noodles. And for the final Hokkaido-inspired touch? A scoop of charred miso corn sizzled with hot oil—smoky, sweet, and irresistibly satisfying.

name: TOYONO Ramen
description: This comforting bowl features a rich, umami-packed broth made with Kaachan Miso—a lovingly handcrafted miso from Toyono Town in Osaka. Each spoonful brings gentle depth and warmth, while the toppings—tender chashu pork, fresh green onions, and handmade chicken meatballs—add layers of flavor and texture. Fragrant bara nori (roasted seaweed) finishes the bowl with a subtle coastal aroma. Don't miss the special pairing of clams and miso, which add a gentle brininess and extra umami to this soulful ramen. A bowl full of hometown care and culinary depth.

name: Kids Ramen
description: A smaller, gentle bowl of ramen made just for kids (elementary school age and under). Choose from two mellow miso flavors: • White Miso – Smooth and comforting • TOYONO Miso – Local miso with a touch of home-style warmth.

name: Minoh Weizen
description: A classic German-style wheat beer brewed by Minoh Brewery. Cloudy and golden, with bright banana and clove aromas, a soft creamy mouthfeel, and a refreshing, slightly tart finish.

name: Minoh Pilsner
description: A crisp, clean Czech-style pilsner with delicate noble hop bitterness. Light straw color, fine carbonation, and a dry, snappy finish make it extremely drinkable.

name: Minoh Stout
description: A full-bodied, dark stout with notes of coffee, cocoa, and roasted malt. Silky smooth, with a lingering roast character and a creamy head that highlights its rich flavor.

name: Minoh Pale Ale
description: A balanced American-style pale ale featuring citrusy hop aroma and a gentle malt backbone. Golden amber color, medium body, with a crisp, refreshing finish.

name: Osaru IPA
description: Minoh Brewery's signature IPA, nicknamed "Osaru." Bursting with tropical fruit and pine aromas, this bold, hoppy beer delivers a smooth bitterness and a bright, lingering finish.

name: Minoh W-IPA
description: A powerful double IPA with extra hop charge for intense citrus, resin, and mango flavors. Higher ABV balanced by a smooth malt body, delivering a satisfying, long-lasting hop finish.

name: Junmai
description:
Pure & Earthy. Robust, deeply expressive, with natural umami and vibrant acidity. Best with hearty dishes.

Characteristics of Akishika Shuzō's Junmai Series: Akishika's Junmai sake is robust and deeply expressive, showcasing the natural umami of the rice. Brewed with low-polished rice and traditional methods, it has a bold structure with pronounced acidity, giving it excellent food-pairing versatility. Its full-bodied profile reflects the brewery's farm-based philosophy and the terroir of Nose Town. Flavor Profile: Rich umami, earthy notes, vibrant acidity. Best Pairing: Hearty dishes, grilled vegetables, fermented foods.

name: Junmai Ginjo
description:
Pure & Earthy. Robust, deeply expressive, with natural umami and vibrant acidity. Best with hearty dishes.

Characteristics of Akishika Shuzō's Junmai Series: Akishika's Junmai sake is robust and deeply expressive, showcasing the natural umami of the rice. Brewed with low-polished rice and traditional methods, it has a bold structure with pronounced acidity, giving it excellent food-pairing versatility. Its full-bodied profile reflects the brewery's farm-based philosophy and the terroir of Nose Town. Flavor Profile: Rich umami, earthy notes, vibrant acidity. Best Pairing: Hearty dishes, grilled vegetables, fermented foods.

name: Junmai Daiginjo
description:
Refined & Aromatic. Elegant fragrance, silky mouthfeel, layered umami. Best with delicate Japanese cuisine.

Akishika's Junmai Daiginjo is a premium expression of their craft, using highly polished rice and careful temperature control during fermentation. Despite its refined character and floral, melon-like aromas, it retains the complexity and natural essence of the rice. It is a sake of quiet power and grace. Flavor Profile: Elegant fragrance, silky mouthfeel, layered umami. Best Pairing: Delicate Japanese cuisine, white fish, or lightly grilled seafood.

name: Aged/Limited Sake
description: Special aged or limited edition sake from Akishika. Please ask staff for details.

name: Akishika Tasting Set
description: Tasting set of 3 Akishika sakes. Experience the range of Akishika's sake craftsmanship.

name: Akishika Highball
description: Refreshing highball made with Akishika sake and soda.

name: Chef's Selection – 5 Seasonal Small Bites
description: A tasting plate of five small dishes, handpicked by our staff. Each set is different—what you get is a surprise! A perfect way to sample a variety of flavors.

name: Warm Tofu with Spicy Miso Meat Sauce
description: Silken tofu topped with savory-spicy miso meat sauce. Deeply flavorful, perfect with rice or sake.

name: Pickled Local Vegetables with Homemade Koji
description: A colorful assortment of locally grown vegetables, pickled with a variety of our house-made koji. Crisp, refreshing, and rich in natural umami.

name: Miso-Marinated Chashu Carpaccio
description: Tender slices of slow-cooked pork, lightly marinated in our rich miso blend, served carpaccio style.

name: Chef's Selection – 7 Oden Items
description: Slow-simmered in a light, flavorful dashi broth, our Oden features a variety of seasonal ingredients, gently cooked to soak up umami. Generous serving of 7 assorted oden pieces.

name: Chef's Selection – 3 Oden Items
description: A smaller tasting set of 3 oden pieces. Great as a starter or side dish.

name: Seasonal Vegetable Platter with Miso & Torched Cheese
description: Seasonal vegetables, artfully presented, coated with Kāchan miso and torched cheese. Rustic and elegant.

name: Fermented Fish & Chips
description: Japanese twist on the British classic. Crispy fried white fish in miso & beer batter, with fermented potato fries.

name: Chilled Tofu with Shredded Leek & Chili Oil
description: Chilled tofu topped with shredded leek and house-made chili oil. Addictive and perfect with sake or rice.

name: Fermented Potato Fries
description: Fries made from Japanese potatoes, salt-water fermented before frying. Unique tangy umami flavor.

name: Fresh-Fried Atsuage with Shoyu Koji
description: Thick-fried tofu made fresh daily, complemented by house-made shoyu koji.

name: Shin Fermented Fried Chicken
description: Minimalist, umami-rich fried chicken marinated with onion koji and garlic, then fermented and fried.

name: Creamy Egg Potato Salad with Miso Mayo
description: Homestyle potato salad with soft-boiled eggs and special miso mayo sauce.

name: Yoidore Set
description: Tasting experience featuring five appetizers paired with Osaka-brewed beer or sake.

name: Choi-Nomi Set
description: Appetizer paired with your choice of one premium beverage. Perfect for a quick drink.

name: Fermentation Gozen Set Meal
description: Limited to 20 servings per day. Customize your set in 4 steps: 1. Choose a Fermented Main Dish — Meat, Fish, or Fermented Karaage (fried chicken) 2. Pick Your Fermented Vegetable Side Dishes — 5 kinds or 3 kinds of small seasonal veggie plates 3. Select Your Miso Ball — Choose your flavor of handmade miso soup base 4. Choose Your Drink — House-roasted Coffee, Oolong Tea, or Syrup Soda (Upgrade to an alcoholic drink for an additional ¥500: Minoh Beer, Akishika Sake, or Wine)

name: Kids Plate
description: A fun and healthy set for children featuring: Fermented Karaage (crispy fried chicken), Potato Fries with house-made fermented ketchup, Steamed Rice & Miso Soup, Comes with a juice! Perfect for little ones to enjoy a nourishing, delicious meal.

name: Kids Rice Set
description: A simple and comforting meal for children, including: Small-sized Steamed Rice, Miso Soup. Perfect for a light, nourishing option for little ones.

name: Daytime Drink Set
description: A perfect midday pairing of three seasonal fermented small plates and one drink of your choice. Drink Options: Draft Minoh Beer (Half pint), Today's Recommended Akishika Sake, Akishika Highball, Isshobin Wine (Red / White)

name: Burnt Shrimp Miso Ramen
description: A bowl of comforting Kyoto white miso broth with a delicate sweetness, infused with dashi for added depth. Topped with a sizzling pour of spicy hot olive oil for a flavorful kick. Toppings include: House-made Yuzu Chicken Meatball, Shredded Leek, Mitsuba Herbs, Rare 'Kaachan Miso' Marinated Chashu.

name: Light Shrimp Miso Ramen
description: A clear, delicate shrimp miso soup accented with fragrant dashi and shrimp oil — light yet full of umami. Toppings include: House-made Yuzu Chicken Meatball, Shredded Leek, Mitsuba Herbs, Rare 'Kaachan Miso' Marinated Chashu.

name: Fermented Vegetables Small Plate
description: A gentle, nourishing side dish made with handmade koji seasonings and locally sourced seasonal vegetables. Enjoy the rich, natural umami of fermentation.

name: Shin Fermented Fried Chicken Set
description: Includes chef's choice of 2 small side dishes, our signature Shin fermented fried chicken, miso soup, and steamed rice.

name: Café Set
description: Includes dessert and our house-roasted coffee (for those who ordered a meal).

name: Dessert & House-Roasted Coffee à la carte
description: Dessert & House-Roasted Coffee (à la carte)

name: Late-Night Special: White Miso Ramen
description: A comforting bowl made exclusively for late-night cravings. Featuring a mellow and slightly sweet white miso broth, this ramen is topped with tender rare char siu, savory chicken meatballs, crisp bean sprouts, wood ear mushrooms, fresh green onions, and sweet sautéed onions.

name: Late-Night Special: Red Miso Ramen
description: A bold and satisfying ramen created just for the night owls. This rich red miso broth packs depth and umami, accented with a hint of sansho pepper for a unique aromatic kick.

name: Late-Night Special: Tsukemen No.6
description: A rich and bold dipping noodle experience featuring a spicy miso base that brings heat and depth in every bite. Enjoy three kinds of pork—tender rare char siu, seared pork slices, and cubed char siu—for a satisfying variety of textures and flavors.

name: Late-Night Special: Tsukemen No.8
description: An indulgent and aromatic dipping noodle dish, Tsukemen No.8 layers deep umami with savory richness. The broth features spicy meat miso and is enhanced with fragrant black garlic oil (mayu), delivering a bold, smoky finish.
